subject: physics
text: Question 1: A particle moves along the x-axis such that its position as a function of time is given by x(t) = 4t³ - 6t² + 3t - 5, where x is in meters and t is in seconds. The acceleration of the particle at t = 2 s is:

subject: physics
text: Question 2: A body of mass 5 kg is moving with a velocity of 2 m/s. The kinetic energy of the body is:

subject: physics
text: Question 3: A particle is moving with a velocity of 5 m/s at t = 0 and has an acceleration of 2 m/s². Its velocity after 10 seconds is:

subject: physics
text: Question 4: A body is thrown vertically upward with a velocity of 19.6 m/s. The maximum height reached by the body is: (g = 9.8 m/s²)

subject: physics
text: Question 5: Which of the following statements is/are correct about simple harmonic motion?
options: Option 1: The acceleration is proportional to displacement
Option 2: The total energy remains constant
Option 3: The velocity is maximum at the mean position
Option 4: The acceleration is maximum at the extreme positions

subject: physics
text: Question 6: Which of the following statements is/are correct about projectile motion?
options: Option 1: The horizontal component of velocity remains constant
Option 2: The vertical component of velocity changes uniformly
Option 3: The path followed is parabolic
Option 4: The acceleration is constant and equal to g

subject: physics
text: Question 7: Which of the following statements is/are correct about electromagnetic waves?
options: Option 2: They can travel through vacuum
Option 3: Their speed depends on the medium
Option 4: They carry energy and momentum

subject: physics
text: Question 8: A body of mass 2 kg is moving with a velocity of 10 m/s. If a constant force produces 100 W of power, the velocity (in m/s) of the body after 5 seconds will be:

subject: physics
text: Question 9: A body is projected with a velocity of 20 m/s at an angle of 30° with the horizontal. The time of flight (in seconds) is: (g = 10 m/s²)

subject: physics
